texts.definition: Games that require players to pay in some for to play.
markups: <style="Definition">Games that require players to pay in some for to play.</style>

People need to have access to games to be able to play them. All games that have to be bought are in a sense <style="CurrentLink">Pay to Play</style>, but this pattern specifically looks at game design that require players to pay to play the game rather than own it.

<style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Category:Gambling%20Games">Gambling Games</link></style> are archetypal examples of games requiring people to pay to play them. Examples include <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Blackjack">Blackjack</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Poker">Poker</link></style>, and <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Roulette">Roulette</link></style>. <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Category:Pinball%20Games">Pinball Games</link></style> and later <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Category:Arcade%20Games">Arcade Games</link></style> such as <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Asteroids">Asteroids</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Donkey%20Kong">Donkey Kong</link></style>, and <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Pac-Man">Pac-Man</link></style> later mechanized this.

Some <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Category:Massively%20Multiplayer%20Online%20Games">Massively Multiplayer Online Games</link></style>, e.g. <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Ultima%20Online">Ultima Online</link></style> and <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/World%20of%20Warcraft">World of Warcraft</link></style>, require players to pay monthly subscription fees to continue playing. Others, e.g. <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Farmville">Farmville</link></style> and <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Candy%20Crush%20Saga">Candy Crush Saga</link></style>, don't require players to pay to play directly but does it indirectly by letting them by upgrades and power-ups.

The easiest solution to designing <style="CurrentLink">Pay to Play</style> is of course to demand payment of players. This can either be in a fee to be allowed to start playing, extra costs during gameplay, or a combination. An alternative is <style="Link"><link="heterogeneous-game-element-ownership">Heterogeneous Game Element Ownership</link></style>, where players in advance need to acquire game elements by paying for them.

<style="CurrentLink">Pay to Play</style> can be applied to allow players to get <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Expansions">Expansions</link></style> and well as provide extra <style="Link"><link="lives">Lives</link></style> so that gameplay can continue even if a <style="Link"><link="game-over">Game Over</link></style> event actually took place. Allowing players to pay for <style="Link"><link="pick-ups">Pick-Ups</link></style> and <style="Link"><link="upgrades">Upgrades</link></style> are indirect ways of creating <style="CurrentLink">Pay to Play</style> as players can get stuck and in effect not be able to progress unless they engage in <style="CurrentLink">Pay to Play</style>.

<style="CurrentLink">Pay to Play</style> provides <style="Link"><link="purchasable-game-advantages">Purchasable Game Advantages</link></style> and is the basic mechanism used to create <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Gambling">Gambling</link></style>. It can be required to have funds to support <style="Link"><link="dedicated-game-facilitators">Dedicated Game Facilitators</link></style>.
